@Keepitquiet: "When it comes to hentai the difference between ntr and netori is ntr is meant to make the reader feel bad and netori isn't." ..... I'm sorry, but you're still way off the mark (also, both netori and netorare can be abbreviated as NTR) ..... As a fetish genre, netorare is typically targeted at would-be cuckolds. While these often are "feel bad" stories, especially for readers who DON'T get off on being cuckolded, misery isn't a requirement. Upbeat, lighthearted netorare stories about open relationships do exist, though they're not common. The only essential characteristic of netorare is the *passive* cuckolding of the main or viewpoint character (MC/VC) ..... In netorase stories, the MC/VC is not cuckolded. Instead, they *actively* cuckold someone else. And netori is typically used as a catch-all tag for the rest: stories in which the MC/VC simply cheats on a partner. For what it's worth, netorase and netori stories can be quite grim and downbeat too.

@KeepItQuiet: "the difference between ntr and netori is that ntr is written to make the reader feel bad while netori isn't" ..... I'm sorry, but that's incorrect. Netori, netorare and netorase are nouns. The differences between them reflect different forms of the verb from which they originate ..... NETORI is a gerund: the unconjugated verb as a noun. It means "cuckolding", "cheating" or "adultery" and is a general term for all stories of his type ..... NETORASE, meanwhile, is a noun based on the *active* form of the verb. It means partner-theft and is equivalent to "cuckolder". In netorase stories, the MC steals someone else's partner ..... NETORARE, finally, derives from the *passive* form of the verb and means "cuckold". In netorare stories, the MC's partner is stolen ..... It's true that in categorizing erotica, the netori tag is generally applied only to non-netorare stories. But this is for convenience and clarity, not an element of the word's definition.

@SanMig: It's more that netorare & netorase are varieties of netori. All these stories are about netori (literally "sleep-theft", a word closely akin to but not exactly the same as the English "cuckolding", "adultery" and "cheating") ..... Netorase is *active* sleep-theft: stealing someone else's beloved by sleeping with them ..... Netorare is *passive* sleep-theft: having your beloved sleep-stolen by someone else ..... Another thing that makes this confusing is that all three words are commonly abbreviated as NTR. Netorase and netorare are practically opposite from one another, yet both are netori, both are NTR.

@xevry Here are the guy & girl names for your perusal in your MTL: Sousuke Urabe (MC), Tetsuya Ogami (MC's cousin), Rion Ogami (FMC, wife of Tetsuya), Mion Ogami (FMC's daughter), Chika Kusakabe (FMC's friend, peach hair), Kaname Hozuki (black hair next door lady), Shion Watanabe (FMC's little sister), Rinka Todoroki (Chika's friend, red hair), Ruri Hozuki (MC's co-worker, tanned), Kyoko Kano (MC's boss, black hair), Erika Ebata (megane childhood friend)

@sione7: The distinction between netori, netorare and netorase does exist, and yes, it's 100% a matter of perspective. That's been my point all along ..... We don't even have to consider "self-insertion". This particular story has been *deliberately constructed* to place the reader in the MMC's head. In reading it, we have access to his thoughts and often see through his eyes. These are common literary/artistic techniques used by the author in order induce reader identification ..... Therefore, this story about netori (cuckolding) is of the netorase (active cuckolder) type. It is not of the netorare (passive cuckold) type.
